alert.note: Alert for Casey; Lincoln (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 4:17PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Lincoln and southeastern Casey Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 417 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Magnum, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Lincoln and southeastern Casey Counties, including the following locations... Boneyville, Lawhorn Hill, Teddy, Ottenheim, Gilpin, Broughtentown, Walltown, Geneva, Lanhamtown and Cantown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
